name: Dream Coat Supernatural Spray Anti-Frizz Treatment
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Hair Styling Products
about: What it is:A spray that keeps straight, wavy, or curly frizz-prone hair silky, glassy, and frizz-free for days..Hair Texture:Straight, Wavy, and Curly.Hair Type:Fine and Medium.Hair Concerns:- Frizz.Key Benefits:- Blocks humidity to prevent frizz.Highlighted Ingredients:- Proprietary Anti-Humidity Complex: Humidity-proofs, prevents frizz, adds shine, and provides heat protection..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:The Dream Coat Supernatural Spray Anti-Frizz Treatment groundbreaking, lightweight, heat-activated polymer technology smooths and silkens hair, forming an invisible matrix that acts like a water-repellent raincoat. It ensures sleek, glossy, glassy texture that keeps hair frizz-free and lasts through three to four shampoos..Fragrance Description:Unscented/Fragrance-Free
ingredients: -Proprietary Anti-Humidity Complex: Humidity-proofs, prevents frizz, adds shine, and provides heat protection..-Chamomilla Extract: Protects color and enriches radiance..-Glycerin: Provides moisture for healthy-looking, shiny hair...Water/Aqua, Dipropylene Glycol, Polysilicone-29, Silicone Quaternium-18, Glycerin, Trideceth-6, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Trideceth-12, Sodium Benzoate, Chlorphenesin, Potassium Benzoate, Disodium EDTA, Citric Acid.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-This spray requires blow-drying with tension to activate..-Shampoo, condition, and lightly towel dry to remove excess moisture..-Divide hair into sections..-Spray liberally and evenly on damp (not wet) Hair to completely saturate..-Do not apply other styling products while the Hair is wet. .-You can apply styling products after completing the Dream Coat blow-dry..-For best results, use every three to four shampoos.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After getting pregnant and not being able to do a Brazilian blowout for months, my hair was in really bad shape. I tried every expensive product and every natural remedy (honey, aloe, apple cider vinegar...anything and everything)  to make it look nice and nothing worked. It was constantly dry so everyday was a ponytail. I had this is my cabinet for months and didn't like it when I initially tried it. I brought it out again as I was desperate and really followed the directions. Made sure to section hair in three parts (my hair is very thick) and saturate each section then blow dried like I usually did with a paddle brush and a round brush in spots. I used my airwrap once it was dry to add some movement. I don't think it lasts multiple washes because I've used it now at every wash which is fine with me. This is my third wash using it and it still works. Doesn't make my hair straight or anything like my brazillian blowout does but helps with the frizz and most importantly, the dryness. I still need to straighten my hair after drying because it is so poofy and curly but once straight, I can add curls with iron and some texture spray and it looks pretty sleek. 60-70% better than it did before so I will continue to purchase this and hopefully once I get a keratin treatment after pregnancy I won't need to use as much in the future. My advice is follow the directions and you will love it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is genuinely one of the worst products I’ve used. I’ve purchased this 2 different times and it is always a disappointment. First of all, the amount of product that you have to use vs price & quantity is terrible. To follow the directions, the smallest size will get you maybe two uses. For reference I have curly dry hair, normal density and a little longer than shoulder length hair. This product has an awful chemical smell and makes my hair look and feel like straw. I followed the instructions to a T, first blowing out with heat and following up with a flat iron. Not even generous amount of oil could gather the hay stack that had become my head. I had to stick my head under water and pray my curls would revert. There are so many quality heat protectants that implore you to not waste your time. I love the bumble and bumble primer, as it gives me silky blow outs and makes my hair feel protected. 0 stars for this product if I could.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: People seem to be confused on how this product works, it is heat activated! It works best when blow drying and straightening to my knowledge as I have never used it before curling my hair. You apply it on wet/damp hair. It will make your hair crusty and sticky if applied on dry hair or is not treated with heat after application. I think it is intended as a heat protectant and I have used it as so when blow drying my natural curls. It helps with frizz but nothing special if thats what you're looking for. Hope this helps people! I have repurchased this product because it helps with frizz, shine, and sleekness but I would love to find a good dupe that is also cruelty free :)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Porcelain skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Both my daughter (extra long, straight and slightly processed hair) and I (extra long wavy greying hair) use this product.  Results completely vary based on how you apply it. It really needs to be applied on wet, towel dried hair, and must coat every hair from root to ends and lastly, you need to blow dry it with the appropriate tools. If we don't follow those instructions, we might as well not use it.  That said, when applied properly, hair looks very healthy, shines and tangles less. Color Wow is also much better than my other heat protection products.

reviews.review_text: I've been using this hair treatment for years and swear by it. Accidentally got a sample of it years ago, and now I purchase it the moment the bottle is empty. My hair almost looks like I'm out of a movie set after applying the spray to damp hair and blowdrying it. Even when I had to switch to a simpler, cheaper shampoo & conditioner, this treatment helped me make my hair look really good. I use it twice a week or so and highly recommend it. A large 200 ml bottle lasts me a year or perhaps even longer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this product every two weeks. If you have frizzy hair then this is for you! Just make sure you read the instructions as this requires heat activation. I put this on generously after I wash my hair, blow dry, and then style. You don't need to use this every wash, for me every 2 weeks is perfect. Keeps my hair less frizzy.

Ever since I started applying this to my hair, I've received so many compliments at work! I apply it differently than how the directions say. I apply before using my curling iron, and then spray a little more after, then brush my curls out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dark skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I gave this product as a gift to my hair stylist in December 2022. She's used that bottle up, has gotten the industrial size and the extra strength version. I'd recommend the extra strength if you have really thick hair. This works. We did a style recently wear she silk pressed half of my hair and the other half was in cornrows. The pressed side stayed straight for a week before I washed it. It rained and snowed that week. I put on my rain hat and my hair was fine afterwards. The few drops that got on my hair caused slight frizz, I took a hair roller and touched up that part over night. My hair stayed sleek for days.     My hair reverted without issue when I washed it.
I don't normally leave reviews but this product is a wow for me. Completely changed my blow out. It made my hair so smooth, so easy to blow out and left it with a gorgeous sheen. An absolute must.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this product for probably the past 5 months and I hadn’t  found another product that makes my hair straighter. I straighten my hair once or twice a week and so that keeps it straight for the rest of the week. Immediately, I noticed that my hair got GREASY quick. That doesn’t usually happen with me so I know it’s from this product. I talked with my stylist and she said use less product or put it on your hands and lightly do the top section of my head. That seemed to work a little better but because this protectant is oil based, there’s not much you can do about that. A huge tip that I learned though is make sure your hair is about 70% wet still or get your hair wet before using your blow brush or blow dryer.

Beware of spraying too much product, as it will leave a bit of residue behind if you spray on too much. And you definitely need to apply tension as the bottle instructions state. Overall, super happy with the product and the result. Not sure if it would work for all hair types though.

I have already purchased the full size and I definitely recommend this product.

After trying it twice and going a walk on a post rainy day I am blown away. My hair did not curl as much or even a little. I am truly impressed and will repurchase a larger size for sure.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've gone through three bottles of this product and thought I'd finally write a review. I have coarse, highly porous, dense, 3C hair;  humidity is my one true nemesis. I've tried everything under the sun, starting in 2006 and continuing until this last year, when I decided to try this stuff. I've found my stupid Holy Grail. Dreamcoat is incredible; it makes my hair shiny, maintains the style/sheen even after sleeping on it for two+ days, and the application lasts 2ish washes before needing to reapply. However, there's a few catches. 1. You need to use an ABSURD amount of product to get the desired results. Think you've sprayed enough??? Think again, and spray some more. It's an expensive item which makes using it so heavily a bit painful. 2. You need follow the directions perfectly, meaning Dream Coat must be sprayed onto your wet hair in small sections, fully brushed through, then resection the hair to blow dry it.* 3. *You must be skilled enough with a blow-dryer and round brush to blow out your hair properly. Maintaining tension, heat, and going through the sections quickly enough so your hair doesn't air-dry is important. Without Dream Coat, I can still dry my hair into this style, it just won't stay if a raincloud is within 300 miles of my location.  I like my hair to look ruffled, but I've included an image of my hair before the ruffling.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I feel like this is just water in a bottle. I had high hopes after reading the reviews, and a beautician recommended this product to me, and i am SO disappointed at how poorly this product works. I use a round blow-dryer brush to blow out my hair so it is straight but bouncy, and i would section off my hair and mist each section then apply heat per the instructions, but as you can see from the photos, my hair stood zero chance against the humidity with this product.

As far as for my natural hair, if found myself constantly trying to blow dry and flat iron my hair so it was no longer frizzy but it seemed to make my hair frizz. Yes my hair was properly blow dried I have done multiple silk presses  on my hair. I still have the product and cant do nothing with it

reviews.review_text: I was so excited to try this today. My hair is somewhere between wavy and curly, and very thick (although the strands themselves are not super thick - I just have a lot of them) with layers. I bought the mini size on my bday and I'm very glad I bought it with a gift card because it was not all that I expected it to be. I wouldn't say my hair is particularly shiney or frizz-free, but it's not worse. The frizz I tend to get on top is maybe a TINY bit less, but not by much and not enough to now go ahead and buy the large size when I run out of the mini. I did all the steps and even flat ironed it after to try to get some extra heat activation as is recommended by some people online, but it's just meh. It doesn't have a nice smell to it (luckily it is not very strong) and it is really just mid. A little disappointed but will continue to use it since I bought it. I could go return it but idek if it's worth the time lol. I did see some reviews saying it takes a couple of applications to really see the difference, so hopefully that will happen for me too. If I can edit this later, I will.

reviews.review_text: It's working perfect but the instructions are not clear enough. Please follow mine to achieve best result. 1) wash hair with shampoo and conditionor 2) use towel to dry hair as much as possible. make sure no water is dropping from your hair after this step 3) apply hair oil to the end and middle of the hair. then apply about 20 times of this product to the whole hair (my hair is near my breast, adjust the amount according to your hair length), don't use too much because it won't help 4) use dryer to air dry hair, can use a comb to help when almost done (the tensions are not necessary)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Easily my new favourite hair product. I have fine, limp, curly and dry hair. I often wear it straight or curled with a flat iron but the slightest bit of humidity and I’m dreadfully frizzy. This product made a massive difference!

After 3 uses- my hair is completely ruined!  It’s dry, it’s frizzy and prone to breakage. Before using this HORRIBLE product my hair was in the best condition if my life. Unfortunately it’s too late to return this product and I have no idea how I am going to repair my hair!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I really really wanted to like this, but alas. I have 4C hair and while I would like to wear my hair straightened sometimes I’ve totally given up because I’m sick and tired of spending hours doing the whole shebang (blow drying, straightening, etc.) and my hair proofing back up LITERALLY MINUTES LATER. Granted, some of it could be where I live and the season (New York, with humid summers) but despite even waiting for cooler, dryer months the issue remains pretty much the same. I’ve been all over YouTube, and I’ve learned a bunch of helpful tricks: - clarifying your hair before a silk press - Apple cider vinegar rinse to completely close cuticles - do silk presses on completely clean hair (as in NO leave ins) - making sure your hair is COMPLETELY DRY before beginning flat ironing  …which I’m sure are helpful to an extent, but I also saw this product being hailed as the holy grail by 3/4 curl type influencers so I thought I’d give it a try.   In short, I’ve tried this product twice to no avail. It just doesn’t work. I was told to try the Extra Strength version of this by similar influencers which I sought out with enthusiasm and hope in my eyes (🤩 <- my naive eyes), with literally the same result: no results.   It might work for people with looser curls (maybe anyone under 3C) but certainly not my 4C tight, coily curls. 😭   Some things of note: - This product weirdly has no smell. When I first used it, I thought maybe I had been scammed and they just sent me water. Nope, it’s the real deal, it just has a super light smell (very, VERY light chemical smell on further inspection).  - It can get a little sticky with buildup (but I did use A LOT, so maybe that’s just me), with the Extra Strength version being a bit stickier.   Good luck if you do end up trying this! Hope it works out. As for me, I’m still on the hunt for my magical 100% humidity-proof product. If it’s not out there yet, I’m sure they’ll crack the code one day. 😢

reviews.review_text: I bought this product after reading a blog post recommending a list of products to achieve the perfect home silk press. Then I did my styling with the ceramic pressing comb to straighten my roots, then flat ironed it all over. My friend complimented my hair at church saying it looked shiny and silky. This product does what it claims and when I run out of this I will happily return to Sephora for a full-sized bottle.

reviews.review_title: Don't believe the 5 star reviews. I actually paid
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I went ahead and bought the largest bottle possible because I read the reviews, I watched the videos, and I have really long hair. My hair gets a bit frizzy, but what I was really going after was this glass like shine that was advertised. Let me tell you, there's some serious photoshopping going on because my hair became dull after using it. The first time I used it I didn't see any change, but it did hold my hair in place a little bit better. I could have used my $5 hairspray to achieve the same result. Only it would have held better. The second time I used it I figured maybe it didn't work as well because I didn't saturate my hair quite as dramatic as I was supposed to. So this time I used a lot. Like I said, I have long hair, all the way down to the bottom of my back, so I used almost half the bottle by this point. After drying/styling my hair, there was still no shine and my hair ended up having the same frizz and now was difficult to get my fingers through. I couldn't even brush my hair that night because it was so full of product. They say this stays in your hair for a few washes and that is definitely true. I couldn't brush my hair properly, without tangled, for over a week. if you want to hold your hair down just use hairspray. This is an expensive product and it does not give the shine as promised. They show a bunch of very young women who have beautiful hair. They always show it in the most frizzed out crazy way that no one's hair actually looks like. And then after they brushed and styled it, it looks gorgeous. Is that not how life is? I'm going to give this product one more chance and then I will either raise my review or lower it down to one star. But there's no chance this will ever get five stars. Like I said, there's no shine. That is literally camera tricks to fool us consumers.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Hair:  Very long, touch, natural curl, color treated with developing grays and prone to frizz  To begin with,  understand my routine, I believe in a good shampoo and conditioner,  wash 1-2 times a week,  an occasional deep conditioner,  stylist visit every 10-12 weeks.  Blow drying my hair is a process. Some people say they have natural curl, I have natural frizz,  especially if I blow dry. I believe less is more,  especially since I highlight my hair. I have a goddess of a stylist, who will spend half an hour to 45 minutes strategically blow drying my hair every visit to leave it looking straight and shiny.    Now that we have the background out of the way,  let's get down to business.   I was seriously contemplating a Brazilian Blowout or Keratin treatments to tame my hair when my stylist dropped this Color Wow Dream Coat in my hand.  Nope,  she wasn't trying to make a sale,  they don't carry it in the salon,  it's her personal product to use with her clientele,  and she is obsessed with it.  The first time she used it I wasn't sure, it was hard to tell the difference since she's a Rockstar with the blow dryer.  However,  three days later when my hair was still shiny,  straight,  frizz free,  and with no knots,  I was amazed.   I started searching online...  The reviews for Dreamcoat are mixed across numerous retailers,  so I was skeptical, but knowing my stylist swears by it,  I looked at it very closely and decided to give it a try.   I read the directions online for how to apply and use it, and began to understand the mixed reviews.  The key is in the HEAT and TENSION on freshly shampooed,  towel dried hair! This product is not intended for dry hair at all, but it's not intended for soaking wet hair either. I use a blow out brush (Drybar's Double Shot) and Dreamcoat and my prayers have been answered!  Follow the directions, heat and tension,  and you'll have the hair you've always dreamed in between those salon visits.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The final step I’ve been missing all my life to get my natural hair to where I want it to be. Previous problem was that I would wash my hair 2 times a week, blow dry with heat protectant and Chi hair oil, but my hair would still be frizzy and puff up due to humidity. It would also be less manageable for updos (think, pony tails/braids).   This treatment I tried on a whim and I’m so glad I did! Used after a full hair wash, in addition to the 2 products described above and a blow dry, I finally have manageable hair with minimal frizz. I feel more confident leaving my hair down now. I’ve even left it down at work for the first time!   Hair type: Medium-textured wavy hair with body. Current Hair treatments: No color or treatments.  Hair length: Long.

reviews.review_text: Let me start of by saying that I am from the Caribbean where humidity and heat are the daily issues!!! So if something works HERE I will praise with all my heart. I recently purchased the mini bottle of this whilst on vacation last year for me to try. My biggest concern when styling my hair is lack of shine, frizz control and the style actually holding more than 5 minutes. I must say I gave in to the hype on the various platforms but this product is sadly not the least bit effective. I was not expecting super model hair ofc but I was hoping for a little more than what I received ( which was absolutely NOTHING!!). Another thing is the smell is not the greatest and is rather hair spray like. Whilst it did not make my hair any worse, it did not make a bit of difference after attempting to “style”. I am of the firm belief that this is targeted to hair that’s pretty much already somewhat healthy and manageable but require a little glam up. It is not for my hair in the Caribbean climate that I live. Also, for the price point I will not purchase the bigger size nor recommend.

reviews.review_title: I Had To Figure It Out
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The first couple of times that I tried this spray, I didn't like it at all. It did speed up drying time and make my hair smooth, but the results didn't even last a day. One drop of humidity and it was over. The directions say to use it after shampoo and conditioner and that's how I was using it. Then I decided to try it without conditioner and it worked beautifully! My hair was shiny, smooth, and frizz-free for days. I received a lot of compliments (and questions lol).The next time, I tried it with Fekkai clarifying shampoo and my hair was still looking great on wash day a week later. This spray does not play well with other products. It works best when my hair is completely clean and I use no other styling products. I rub on a few drops of hair oil when I've finished blow drying and flat ironing, but that's it. For reference, my hair is super coily, color-treated, and not relaxed. I use a Conair dryer and a Croc flat iron, both on high heat. I haven't noticed any heat damage so far. Four stars because it doesn't last through 3 shampoos for me. But it does last through one shampoo. The photo was taken the next day after washing and styling. I had used Dream Coat the previous wash day a week earlier. I love it.

reviews.review_text: I tried this on a friend's recommendation ahead of a summer business trip, where I'd have to spend a good deal of time outdoors. At the end of a full day visiting multiple business sites out in the in high heat / humidity and even misters (yep, my business trip involved visiting a theme park at one point - it's a great job ...), I still had gorgeous, smooth hair. Only a fresh Keratin treatment has ever given me results this good (and I had NO keratin left in my hair at the time of this trip). Can't recommend this enough - it's a secret weapon! My only note is that those results don't last through washes - you'll still get some benefit after a wash, but for top results, you'd have to reapply each time. But still so worth it - beats having to sit through a keratin treatment any time!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: At 45 years old, and long blonde hair, I think I've probably tried every anti frizz treatment, spray, cream known to man (known to women actually 😉). This stuff is a major game changer and never will another product ever touch my hair. It is IMPERATIVE that you follow directions exactly otherwise it won't work. Being able to chat or discussions on the Sephora platform is where this is important. I bought the mini and I almost used the whole bottle, but I have thick shoulder length hair. It has a strange texture when applying, must be generously applied by sections after towel drying. DO NOT hold back, the purpose is to have each strand of hair coated, brush through hair gently and simply blow dry. It's like just stepping out of the salon it looks and feels so beautiful! My blonde locks are silky shiny and light as air...I couldn't believe what I was seeing and feeling. No need to think, every woman should have this product and I will be replacing my hair products with other ColorWow ASAP!

reviews.review_title: NOW IT IS NECESSARY FOR ME....
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I JUST USED IT AND I THINK IT TOOK AWAY MY FRIZZ AND MY STRAIGHTENING LASTED A LOT LONGER....

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased the Color Wow dream coat after hearing and seeing so many great things about it. I watched so many videos with tips so I felt like I knew how to use it by the time I got it. I have naturally curly hair that gets even more curly and frizzy in humid weather. I also live in hot humid South Florida where you feel like you are in a constant sauna. In fact, it’s usually pointless for me to even dry and straighten my hair because as soon as I step outside the frizz begins and if it rains forget about it. But let me tell you this stuff works! It is magical. The key is to use way more than you think. You really have to make sure every part of your hair is coated. And then this is activated by heat. And I feel like it needs more than just the heat of a blow dryer. It also needs a styling tool to set it. And when I do those steps my hair is perfect and smooth. No frizz. And it lasts, through humidity, through rain. My hair still looks perfect like I got a blowout. After I use this product, the next time I wash my hair I use a clarifying shampoo and a hydrating conditioner and my curls are still perfect. So this product doesn’t weigh them down or damage them. I’m so impressed I’ve already repurchased.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin

Second day hair with just a little bit of refresher spray is phenomenal! My curls were defined with no frizz. I highly recommend even for curly hair.

reviews.review_text: I receieved this complimentary from colorwow. This heat protectant is absolutely amazing I remember the first time I had tried this out and how shiny and soft my hair felt. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am honestly shocked at how great this product is. This made combing wet hair and drying my hair SO MUCH easier. I have fine hair that gets easily tangled after I wash it and until now, no products helped me easily comb my hair. This leaves my hair very soft. I would caution though to go easy because it can weigh your hair down a little if you use too much. I will continue buying this as part of my permanent hair routine. WOW! The first time I used it, my hair was straight & curved under on the ends - just the way I wanted it. AND ... it stayed straight even when it was drizzling rain outside - a minor miracle!! My search is over - this is the stuff for me from here on out! Keep in mind, though, that it's heat activated. However, I was in a rush the other morning & didn't dry it - just put a scrunchie in it & went. Of course, it was wavy, but definitely not frizzy!! Yay!!! Anyway, sorry for the long review, but I thought it might help someone else with the same hair issues. Gifted by color wow

It’s supposed to last 3-4 shampoos and so far my hair still feels and looks amazing after a couple of shampoos.  It’s definitely more shiny, soft, and less tangled since using.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have long, very frizzy, thick colored hair. I like blowing my hair out and straightening it regularly,  so I'm always  trying new products to find that dream product. I've definitely come across amazing ones, and read the reviews snd thought, let me give WOW Dream Coat a shot. I wasn't impressed.  It didn't do anything to my hair that a regular blowout couldn't do. I've used less expensive products tjst worked far better.  Not worth the money,  imo. I spend a lot on hair tools and products and know how to use them. This might be good for fine or already straight or wavy hair, but I seriously don't even feel anything when i spray it on my hand, so thats probably why theres no  'sheen' when applied.  I tested it in all kinds if environments too. Did fine in dry, sunny, low humidity days. Not great during dsys of higher humidity.  Keep in mind when doing a good blowout,  you don't really need product unless you want that ultra shine, in which case this didn't do it. I wanted long term temporary frizz free hair on humid days. This is not the product I'd choose. Wouldn't recommend.
This product is overrated.My hair looks and feels the same.  This product doesn't even have a smell . I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.

reviews.review_title: A must-have for living on the Gulf Coast!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Wow is right! I live in the Gulf Coast area (read humid climate) and it works great on my hair. Just be sure to apply heat and tension (I use the Revlon One-Step Volumizer hair dryer) to activate the product. I apply it every 3rd shampoo (using a clarifying shampoo). The manufacturer recommends that no other styling products are applied when applying Dream Coat (when it's wet) so I don't use my regular styling products with it but I find that I actually don't need them. On the first and second shampoo afterwards, I return to using my usual styling products. After the third shampoo, I use Dream Coat again by itself. According to the ingredient list, it doesn't have any added fragrance (I'm not a fan of fragrance in beauty products) but it does have a very slight scent from its ingredients; I can't smell the scent at all after my hair is dried. I can tell that the product is truly sealing moisture into my hair because when I dry my hair after applying Dream Coat, I don't see the usual steam rising. I'm glad that Sephora sells this in the 500mL size!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 10/10 recommend! My normal, Hair Stylist is moving away to Georgia and I wanted to work on doing my own blowouts at home, especially with my type of hair, which is mixed African-American! I stumbled upon this product online and watched a few videos and made sure to study the instructions of making sure your hair is damp and not overly soaked, spraying by section, which I actually sprayed all over instead of bisection top to bottom and I even bought the hair mask that was recommended by this brand as well. At first it felt like I was spraying water on my hair and didn’t have much of a scent, same thing with the hair mask and I was a little worried my hair wasn’t going to be nice and hydrated. However, by the time I blow dry my hair and sectioned everything my hair blowout very nice and smooth. Then I went ahead and flat ironed my hair thoroughly section by section and my hair was very silky, felt nice in sleek, was not feeling weighed down with any product and was very bouncy! I’m definitely going to be buying this again including the hair mask. Pro tip. If you have curly thick hair and or are African-American, please make sure to apply it when the hair is damp and apply a lot of tension to the hair with your blow dryer and comb through it and make sure you have a good heat on your flat iron.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was influenced to purchase this product and did so during the Spring Sale - but I honestly wasn’t expecting to get the results that I did. Right after my first use I was honestly shocked at how shiny my hair was. My hair wasn’t really damaged or dull to begin with so I wasn’t expecting significant results but the shine I got was unreal. But the really impressive effects of this product was the humidity control. I moved to Seattle a few years ago and have been battling with frizz and unruly waves ever since. This product helped my hair stay smoothed for DAYS! Not only in humidity - but rain as well!! The results were SHOCKING! After a few uses I’m absolutely hooked. I’ve found it works best if I am incredibly generous with the application (don’t worry, it doesn’t weight down your hair or leave residue! Another big plus) and use tension like a blow dry brush to style. Honestly a game changer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My hair looks and feels softer using this. I can actually get my ends looking smooth. My other heat protectant treatment doesn’t do this much for them.   Here is a photo of my hair after a super quick blow dry.  The test will be seeing if my hair holds up in humidity. I have naturally curl hair so my hair is almost always a disaster in the summer. Will have to update in a few months when the warm weather comes around.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I hardly ever leave reviews, especially negative ones, however, this was not it for me. I used my points to get a mini of this product and I am happy I did not blindly buy it. I dyed my hair, washed it, put my leave in and cream in and then used this, once my hair air dried a little, I blew my hair out with my amika round blow dryer like I always would but it was so hard to blow my hair out because of this product. It made my hair sticky and just feel rough, I have never experienced anything like it. My ends were knotted together right after I brushed my wet hair, my other hair products never do this so I know it was this product. It weighed my hair down too and overall just made it feel filmy and sticky. I wouldn’t use this again. I was upset because I had just freshly dyed and washed my hair, it didn’t do what I thought it would. I even read and followed the directions correctly and made sure too, this product just wasn’t it for me. I would try before you buy.

I bought this product because of the good reviews on tik tok, I followed the instructions and I even did it as it appears in the videos that appear here at sephora but it didn't work for me.  I have the same frizz as if I had not used the product.  I do not recommend it, it is not worth paying that amount so that it does not work later.

reviews.review_text: thankfully i just received a sample, because i'd have been really disappointed if i'd spent $30 on this.  with average hair (medium on the fine side) that has become curly and frizzy in recent years, i guess i expected the effort to use this according to instructions would result in something at least somewhat above average.  instead... my hair ended up looking like it does with no treatment at all.  after hundreds of dollars spent trying to manage what has become difficult hair, this was my last attempt at overpriced chemical products.  sticking to coconut oil from here on out - which, curly, frizzy haired ladies, i've found is the best bet of all.  30 seconds to heat, 5 seconds to apply, $4 for a jar that will last a year; pure silk afterward.

I have soft hair with 3a/3b curl hair type. I do not feel this would effectively straighten or control frizz on tighter coils, or humans with coarse hair (natural dreadlocks, or straight horse hair dry coarse textured hair) would notice a softening effect.   There are much better oils and serums out there that you do not need to use nearly as much product to be effective. Second image is my hair air drying without products other than a competitor's hair oil with a straightening component. I obviously still have frizz, but I also did not use heat.

I really try to reduce build up and deliberately putting on something that doesn’t wash out is a little cringey. It really didn’t do much my hair overall, it probably reduced frizz a bit but made it look a little weighed down in return, I ended up having to wash my hair sooner then my norm. I have other products I like to use so the fact it says to only use their product alone is kind of a red flag for a marketing ploy. I also prefer a cream blow dry protectant. Will not repurchase, glad I only got a small bottle. I find I get the same amount of frizz reduction by simply finishing off my style with a hair oil. Might work better for curly or corse hair, I think it was a bit to heavy for my fine strands. If your goal is long term hair health then this isn’t best product, there’s nothing nourishing, it your just looking for something for a quick frizz fix then it might work for you.

reviews.review_text: More than five stars. I'm still collecting my thoughts after this product proved its worth...   I didn't take its claims super seriously when I purchased this, but it had great reviews so I though I'd try it out. Let me just tell you... first of all, my hair has been impossibly soft ever since I started using this. Even on days I don't use it.  Here's the thing I'm trying to understand. I live in Santa Monica, CA. Right near the beach. If I get within 2.5 blocks of the ocean, my hair frizzes out into outer space. But when I douse my hair in this and dry it, my hair......stays styled? Near the ocean? I can get as close to the beach as I want to and my hair looks the way I styled it when I go home.  For that reason alone, if you live anywhere humid, BUY THIS YESTERDAY!!

reviews.review_text: 10/10 I started with a mini because I was curious about it then I purchased the full size before running out of the mini because I was worried about being without it. I’m still using the mini size, it’s lasted about 4 months so far. I use this on days that I blow dry/straighten my hair. I have curly hair (2c-3a) and wash 1-2 times a week. I try to leave it curly one wash and straighten the other wash. Using this, I wash my hair as normal, apply other products out of the shower, air dry for up to two hours and then when I’m ready to use the AirWrap, I section out my hair and spray this all over each small section and blow dry smooth. No frizz, it’s like magic I swear. I was amazed when using it the first time and I don’t think I could live without this. next I’ll try the curly hair version of this

reviews.review_text: For my hair, there were both pros and cons to this product. It did make the lengths of my hair feel softer and silkier, and the product is lightweight.  But it didn't add the shine that everyone raves about, it left my ends feeling dry, and I still had some flyaways near my part.  Someone told me I might not be using high enough heat or tight enough tension when I'm blowdrying -- but I feel like intensifying the heat and tension on my hair could cause more damage. I don't want to risk long-term breakage for short-term benefits. Definitely planning to return this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: blonde hair

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was really impressed with this product! After some trial and error, I find it's best to really coat your hair with the spray and be generous in your application. You need to be generous to get the full effect, and it's best when applied on damp (not wet) hair. It's also best applied as a final product. I use it with my hair oil and other heat protectant, and it's best to use this as the last product in my opinion. My hair felt much silkier even after a couple of washes. It feels like I just got fresh toner and leave my hair with that same smooth hydrated feel. I also love that this product isn't heavy on the hair! I can coat my hair thoroughly with the spray, and it's not heavy at all, it really doesn't leave a residue which I was initially concerned about. My hair is fine and dense, and mostly straight. For my hair type, I really love this product and would definitely recommend.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to love this....But I am not impressed
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this product! I have curly 3b type hair. I have been looking for a product that makes my hair look and feel nice when I straighten it. Usually when I blow dry and straighten it, my hair is dry, frizzy, and doesn't take long to curl up, especially at the roots. I decided that with all the great reviews for this product, that I would give it a try. Attempt 1: I used the product as directed. Towel dried hair, sprayed liberally and blow dry with tension to activate. I even watched a video of the creator using it on curly hair! After blow drying using my revlon roll brush, my hair was POOFY and frizzy HOWEVER it felt very soft which I loved. I then straighened it and had to add some hair oil at the ends. My hair was okay but def curled up at the roots especially at the gym and my hair was not frizz free. I had to keep restraightening it or blowdrying it because my ends and sometimes roots were curling up. I also kept using a hair oil to keep it sleek and frizz free which helped a lot. Attempt 2: I gave the product a second try. This time I tried using a roll brush and blow dryer first but there was not enough tension. So I went back to the revlon roll brush at a higher heat setting and my hair was looking nicer when blow dried and feeling very soft like before. I then tried straightening it and again it wouldn't really straighten and curled up. THEN, I went outside ( it has been raining all day and night). My hair was covered and mind you I just straightened it again. When I arrived to my destination it was FRIZZY and curled up already! Overall, I think this product is good for some hair types but NOT ALL hair types. I love how soft my hair was but for the amount of hype this product is getting, it isn't worth it. I even tried the water drop test and it soaked through my hair (again followed the directions correctly). So sad this didn't work for my hair:(. On to the next search for a product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: So I bought the small bottle of this spray. I used it on damp hair and immediately felt a difference. I also paired with Pureology 21 spray and I loved the end result. Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.review_text: Followed instructions to the letter. Results weren’t even close. In fact, because you can’t use your regular pre-blow dry products my hair actually looked dryer.  Returning it tomorrow.

reviews.review_text: I have used this about 3-4 times now, and love it. I have long, wavy/curly hair, dyed, dry but not damaged, fine but lots of it. I am not great at blowouts, but I followed the directions, did it in sections, sprayed a lot, and it really worked. reviews.review_title: Helps soften and thicken my fine, damaged hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Bought this on Amazon but felt the need to write a review because I’m impressed! My hair is really fine, color treated, the ends are sad, but I try to avoid heat as much as possible. That said, I’m willing to use heat to activate this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ll start by saying that I have a very difficult hair texture as it is extremely curly underneath and pretty straight on top. I’m also a natural redhead so I try to avoid heat tools especially that none of them really work for me. Enter colorWow. I can honestly say in 25 years of doing my hair and getting it done, I’ve never been able to achieve this result at home. I have the L’ange brush dryer which I have been very meh about. But, turns out with the right product, I am ACTUALLY getting a salon quality blowout. My hair is smooth, silky, under control, fresh, and bouncy. ColorWow is ridiculously good - if it doesn’t work for you, use more or use it on damp hair.. it’s all about the technique, the actual product will deliver if used right. In awe of how great it is. For comparison, two photos a day apart - my natural curls and hair straightened with ColorWow and L’Ange.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been disregarding the ratings/reviews on here more and more lately after noticing they haven’t been aligning with reality in recent years. Not sure what’s changed, but the consensus has gotten way less reliable. Unless the formula in the large size is different from what was in the deluxe samples available by promo code a few months ago, I can’t possibly understand the negative reviews. I have waist-length, coarse/damaged, dyed hair with lots of breakage and only need 4 sprays of this stuff on towel-dried hair (I divide my hair in half and use 2 sprays per side). I distribute it evenly through with a comb then blowdry while pulling hair taut as per instructions. I get holy-grail-level softness/anti-frizziness/manageability that greatly reduces the time it takes to flatiron my hair, and lasts even after another wash or two, and somehow avoids making my roots greasy. I live on the Gulf Coast where we have 100% humidity almost every day and this stuff is incredible. I think it’s probably best for damaged, fine Caucasian hair, especially long hair and people who flatiron after blowdrying. The small bottle lasts forever, too

reviews.review_text: This product works perfectly for my curly, frizzy and thick hair. Might it is amazing 😻.

reviews.review_title: Better than other anti humidity products.
reviews.review_buyer_description: brown hair
reviews.review_text: Have used this product a few times and overall would recommend. My hair is curly and frizzy in humidity, but I can blow dry smooth easily. When using this product I did find my hair was extra silky smooth and the frizz did stay away, but not perfectly.  A few items to note: 1. I only wash my hair 1-2 times per week. I found the product works for 1 week without washing not 3 washes. 2. I would not recommend using this product back to back all the time. When I used this 3 weeks in a row it heavily dried my hair. I also found I lost more hair when using continuously.  3. When applying, make sure your hair is wet and take the time to heavily apply and comb through section by section. Blow dry completely.    Overall, I will be using this whenever I go on vacation to a humid climate and would recommend for special occasions, but not daily use.

This product did absolutely nothing for humidity and I bought the big size and drenched my hair as directed.
Pretty much used it as shown by the creator of it and my hair still was frizzy and it didn’t make it soft or shiny .

The results blew me away. I sprayed it throughout my hair, I try not to go too heavy with the product and let it air dry for a little bit and then use my blow dryer and I was seriously amazed. Let me tell you, I have used A LOT Of different hair products and this is easily one of my favorite now. My hair was super soft minimum frizz and it looked like I just straightened my hair. It also lasted for a decent amount of time, maybe two or three days with some light touch ups with my straightener. I would definitely recommend trying this product if you were looking for some thing to control the frizz in your hair and get a sleeker look!

reviews.review_title: I have no idea why people don’t like this.

reviews.review_text: I have been searching for the perfect anti-frizz product for quite some time, and this is it.  No matter the shampoo/conditioner you use, you can spray this throughout your damp hair and it perfects every strand. I have thin fine hair that is usually very frizzy by nature.  But when I use this, my hair becomes silky, shiny, smooth and beyond 100% frizz free. Like a magazine ad almost seriously.   I only gave it four stars though because you do have to dry your hair with tension when you use this. Some Colorwow products are like that, you have to either dry with heat or use tension or both, so keep that in mind as to not waste product.  But also, like this one, some Colorwow products are supposed to last 3 shampoos so you are definitely getting your money's worth.

reviews.review_title: Temporary shine and more split ends
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this product for 1.5 months now with 2 hair wash days a week. For reference, I have thin (hair density), medium-fine (hair thickness), medium porosity (hair moisture absorption/retention). It is considered long, layered, and recently dyed dark black; however, natural hair is already closer to brown black (just had bad balayage from 2 years ago that fades bottom). I use the revlon brush once a week and sometimes followed by hot tools. Prior to Dreamcoat, I was trying out multi-tasking leave ins for years like Pureology Colour Fanatic, Redken One United (top 2), It’s a 10, Ouai, Olapex 6&7, Eva NYC mane magic, and Shea moisture’s styler (top 2). My usual routine before my revlon brush would be shampoo 2x (sometimes Olapex 3 in between washes), apple cider vinegar rinse, hair mask in shower (alternating between hydration, protein, combos-based), leave-in conditioner, then Paul Mitchell’s skinny serum. I had pretty silky hair, mostly free from split ends too. I tried dreamcoat on its own after the shower then blow dried and my hair looked shiny and bouncy. Nothing different than my usual results though, other than one-less product used. But dreamcoat couldn’t compete with San Francisco’s humidity. After one shift at work (indoors, but public-transportation commute) my hair was frizzy at the roots! I was able to brush it smooth again that night and apply argan oil to my ends which made my hair look nice the next morning. However, it kept getting frizzy on the days leading to my next wash so I was applying more products closer to my roots. The buildup was getting me oily faster. I think my hair needed more moisture which I would get with the multitasking leave-in then sealed and shined with skinny serum. I also learned after 2 weeks, my hair needed more heat protectant because ends were dry and splitting. So basically, I ended up using dreamcoat 2x a week w/ heat protectant. 2 products again post-shower, but the other combos last longer w/out dryness.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This stuff is IT! I was in Finland for a week and it’s very humid there in the summer. Used this every other day after washing my hair because this stuff lasts! I had so many colleagues asking how my hair wasn’t frizzy and how my fly always were tamed.. well this is it!

reviews.review_text: This 100% works. It lasts me a few days as well - though it won't look 100% like it did on day 1 it's still better than nothing. I have thin hair but I have a ton of it and my hair tends to lean on the more dehydrated side so I struggle to find products that will help tame frizz without being overly saturating on the moisture.  I would recommend starting with less than you think you need and adding more as necessary. I find that I don't need to completely saturate my entire head like the instructions suggest to get it to work. I have to imagine that oversaturating your hair with this will end up weighing your hair down in the end. I do a top and bottom section and spray a few sprays for each layer and that does the trick. reviews.review_title: Thick , long, & low porosity hair - meh results
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For reference, my hair is 2a, almost waist length, low porosity, thick with average/slightly coarse density. It’s also darkest brown/natural black. Bc of its color & porosity, it is already very shiny. However, I do struggle with frizz, especially after blow drying. I was recommended this product by my stylist and was very excited to try it out based on the claims.  Now, because of how my hair is, I know that no matter what it says on the bottle, I will need at least twice that amount of product. I read the reviews before buying this and knew it wouldn’t last me long. One use is about 1/4 of the full size bottle for me, at minimum. I would’ve been okay with that if it worked well, but that hasn’t been my experience.  I’ve tried it twice: the first time, it did nothing, but I think it was user error — I don’t think I used enough product and I also don’t think I blow dried w/ enough tension.   The second time, I used a TON of product and took a lot of time to make sure I blow dried well. It did.. a little? Right after blow drying, it was as frizzy as ever. After brushing and letting my hair cool, there was some improvement. I ended up straightening it with a bit of argan oil on the ends of my hair.   The results I got:  - less frizzy (still gets frizzy easily, but I can tame it with finger combing even when out and about) - silky/ gets less tangled  - my straightening lasted much longer than usual   Results I didn’t get: - glass hair (my hair is no shinier than usual, though it’s always pretty shiny) - lasting through shampoos - no frizz (definitely still get it, just maybe 50% less and easier to tame)  I believe the hype, I honestly think it just doesn’t work as well on my hair (and with my skill level — I wouldn’t be surprised if a professional could get it to work). Based on the results I got, I’m more likely to try another product for this issue instead of repurchasing. I just don’t think it’s worth the price for the results I got & how much I had to use !

Could get away with not running a flat iron through my hair because it wasn’t frizzy after blow drying at all. Feels healthy like I used a treatment mask. I wash every every other day and the product kept my hair well styled and not frizzy in humid Minnesota 100 degree heat. Will purchase the full size and think it is at a fair price point.

reviews.review_text: Honestly this product is way over hyped on social media. It's super mediocre. The only thing I'll say is that it didn't get AS frizzy as it normally would when I went outside.  I guess I expected too much. I personally don't think it's worth the 28$ I spent. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: from the bad reviews I feel like people are not using the products  correctly  . for me the easiest way was spray in sections then add my  volumizer by wow  and the root lifer. I  comb it through and I   blow dry the roots to get the volume then used my Revlon  blow dryer to blow dry straight small  sections  at a time. My hair fells silky. didn't  use and other product besides these just to make sure  it worked.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product did the exact opposite to my hair than what it advertised: My hair was frizzer than ever! I followed the instructions, and while I did see some of the water rolling off the hair effect right after blow drying, my hair ended up heavy and super frizzy, way worst than my minimally frizzy natural hair. I’d highly recommend you DON’T buy this, unless you like throwing money away and/or hate your hair.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This didn’t give me as much shine as I was hoping for, but this is the only product I’ve ever used that didn’t leave me with puffy, frizzy hair after blow drying. I went for 2 hour walk after using it while the humidity was at 90% and it looked the exact same as it did when I left the house! I’ll definitely be purchasing the full size!!
